plugins.name: Unidup
plugins.description:
Create a design set template that includes component usage and color schemes. With this plugin, you can duplicate your template to a new page, automatically apply new instances of the original component's new variants under consistent layers, and create brand new color schemes.


Additionally, color schemes can be exported in JSON format.



Document Preparation


Document Structure: Prepare the design drafts of the design scheme, which should include "Components Page" and "Template Page", as well as "Color Scheme".


Naming: Each reuse of the design scheme should have a unique name, let's tentatively call it "NAME". This naming is very important as it runs through the entire reuse process.


Template Page: The "Template Page" is the page of your design scheme, and its name should be called NAME. It will play a big role in subsequent work, transforming into various new outputs and serving various new purposes. Therefore, each artboard should contain instances of components for reuse.


Components Page: Each time the design scheme is reused, the output should be unique. The "Components Page" contains unique elements in each set of outputs, and each component should include variants, with the key of the variant being "name" and the value being NAME, to correspond with each set of outputs.


Color Scheme: The naming method for local color schemes in figma is xxx/xxx. When naming, please follow the structure NAME/color1, NAME/color2.



How to Use


Duplicate and Export JSON are two main functions.


Duplicate:

There are three cards in the interface, namely "Components Page", "From Template", and "New Page Naming".


  1. Select your "Components Page", click the "Apply Selected Page" button to the right of "Components Page", and the card will display the details of the "Components Page".
  2. Select your "Template Page", click the "Apply Selected Page" button to the right of "From template", and the card will display the details of the "Template Page".
  3. In the "New Page Naming" card, name your new output.
  4. Click the "Duplicate" button, and you have extended a new output from the "Template Page". Modify the associated components and color scheme, and this output is ready.



Export JSON:

It will list the NAME of all your output schemes, click to export the rgba color values, and download the json to your local.




See usage demo file:

https://www.figma.com/file/jUg3U53QSIzWBEn0RfUdB0/
plugins.tagline: Unidup - An easy way to reuse your design set

plugins.name: Feature-Labeler
plugins.description:
Create numbered badges and description frames for your wireframes with ease. Streamline your design documentation process by adding sequential numbered references to features and their explanations. Convenient for product specifications, user flow documentation, and design handoffs.


  1. Create a Number Badge
  2. Select the badge size (small, medium, or large)
  3. Choose a color from preset options or use the color picker
  4. Click "Create" to add a numbered badge to your design
  5. Create a Description Frame
  6. Select the frame size (small, medium, or large)
  7. Click "Create" to add a description frame with a matching number
  8. Edit Badges and Descriptions
  9. Click on any badge or description frame to edit
  10. Change numbers to reorder the sequence automatically
  11. For badges, you can also update the color
  12. Organize Documentation
  13. Place badges next to UI elements you want to reference
  14. Add explanatory text in the description frames
  15. Badges and descriptions with the same number are linked in the sequence


와이어프레임에 번호가 매겨진 뱃지와 설명 프레임을 쉽게 생성하세요. 기능과 설명에 순차적인 번호 참조를 추가하여 디자인 문서화 프로세스를 간소화합니다. 제품 사양, 사용자 플로우 문서화 및 디자인 인계에 편리하게 활용할 수 있습니다.


  1. 번호 뱃지 만들기
  2. 뱃지 크기 선택 (small, medium, or large)
  3. 미리 설정된 색상 중에서 선택하거나 색상 선택기 사용
  4. "Create" 버튼을 클릭하여 디자인에 번호가 매겨진 뱃지 추가
  5. 설명 프레임 만들기
  6. 프레임 크기 선택 (small, medium, or large)
  7. "Create" 버튼을 클릭하여 일치하는 번호의 설명 프레임 추가
  8. 뱃지 및 설명 편집
  9. 편집하려는 뱃지나 설명 프레임을 클릭
  10. 번호를 변경하면 시퀀스가 자동으로 재정렬됨
  11. 뱃지의 경우 색상도 업데이트 가능
  12. 문서 정리
  13. 참조하려는 UI 요소 옆에 뱃지 배치
  14. 설명 프레임에 설명 텍스트 추가
  15. 같은 번호의 뱃지와 설명은 시퀀스에서 연결됨
plugins.tagline: Simplify wireframe annotations with numbered badges and descriptions

plugins.name: Magic Style Guide
plugins.description:
✨ Magic Style Guide ✨

Create beautiful, clear, professional style guides — in just one click.


Magic Style Guide reads all your color variables (across multiple collections, including linked variables) and text styles to instantly generate an elegant, organized, and ready-to-share style guide.

Perfect for onboarding, documentation, and developer handoff — without any manual work.


---


🔮 Features:


- One-click magic: Instantly document all text styles and color variables.

- Smart descriptions: Auto-generate usage notes based on your style names.

- Linked variables support: Handles both direct and linked variables across collections.

- Multi-collection ready: Organizes styles beautifully even when they span several collections.

- Beautiful output: Clean, professional, and fully structured style guides.


---


Why you'll love it:

Save hours of boring documentation.

Keep your design systems clear, consistent, and ready for scale.

Focus on design — Magic Style Guide takes care of the rest. 🎩✨
plugins.tagline: Generate stunning style guides from Figma styles and variables — instantly!

130996.release_notes:
🖋️ Text Style Layout Glow-Up
I gave the text styles section a makeover. It’s now sharper, more elegant, and way easier to scan. Like a well-dressed typeface at a job interview.

🧠 Smart Descriptions for Humans
Now automatically adds short, helpful descriptions based on text sizes and color names. No more guessing what “Primary / Surface / Subtle” actually means.

🪄 New Plugin UI (because vibes matter)
The plugin window got a redesign — cleaner layout, a proper call-to-action, and even a lovely image… just for the aesthetic. Nothing essential, but everything nice.

plugins.name: Figma Instance Mode
plugins.description:
Inspired by this post: Please add an "Instance Selection" mode - Share an idea - Figma Community Forum


🔶 Introducing Figma Instance Mode


- ⤴️ Select Instance

- ✅ Instance Mode On

- 🚫 Instance Mode Off


⤴️ Select Instance


check if there is a parent or ancestor instance with your selection, and then will redirect your selection to the instance


It is the same as the official feature named `select instance`, but with this plugin you can blind a hotkey to this feature.


✅ Instance Mode On


Once you run this command, every time when you change your selection in Figma will run the `⤴️ Select Instance` command automatically which means you will always select the instance if your selection is within a instance.


And there will be a inspect window to show the program running result, you can get information with it.


🚫 Instance Mode Off


This feature is to turn off the instance mode, and close the inspect window


🔶 How to add GLOBAL SHORTCUT in MacOS


Check the tutorial: Custom-shortcuts-in-figma by Jussi Virtanen


MacOS Global Shortcut Path:


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->⤴️ Select Instance


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->✅ Instance Mode On


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->🚫 Instance Mode Off

accepted.name: RyanHuang 👀
accepted.description:
🔸 Product Designer
🔸 Heavy user of Figma
🔸 Beginner in FE

plugins.tagline: Selecting parent/ancestor instances automatically

  1. Positions your book cover perfectly within the Notion image dimensions

Step by step instructions:

  1. Upload a book cover image
  2. Plugin creates a frame containing the formatted image
  3. Export the frame
  4. Upload to Notion as "Files & Media"

plugins.name: Console CLI
plugins.description:
Console CLI lets you control Figma using commands. You can list fonts, styles, and components, create shapes, get details about selected elements, check file analytics, and view user info.


Commands:

  1. help : See available commands
  2. ls : Lists data related to fonts, styles, or components
  3. ls fonts : List all fonts used in the file
  4. ls styles : List all styles used in file file
  5. ls components : List all components in the file
  6. shape : Create a new shapes based on the specified type
  7. shape rect <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create rectangle
  8. shape circle <diameter> [x] [y] : Create circle
  9. shape ellipse <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create ellipse
  10. shape polygon <sides> <radius> [x] [y] : Create polygon
  11. shape star <points> <outer-radius> <inner-radius> [x] [y] : Create star
  12. selection : Info about the currently selected nodes
  13. selection --verbose : Additional details about the selection
  14. analytics : Retrieve file analytics
  15. whoami : Retrieves info about the current user
  16. clear : Clear the console
  17. exit : Close the plugin
plugins.tagline: CLI for Figma. List elements, create shapes, get selection info, and check file analytics.

plugins.name: Accessibility Checker
plugins.description:
Make your designs accessible to everyone with this comprehensive accessibility checker. This plugin combines automated testing with guided manual review to ensure your designs meet accessibility standards.


🔍 AUTOMATED CHECKS

- Text contrast analysis against backgrounds

- Font size verification for readability

- Overlapping elements detection

- Missing alt text detection


✅ INTERACTIVE CHECKLIST

Track your progress with a persistent checklist covering key accessibility criteria:

- Contrast and readability

- Color usage and clarity

- Image descriptions and alt text

- Language simplicity

- Animation limits

- Overall design clarity


💡 EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES

Each accessibility issue includes a direct link to relevant WCAG guidelines and best practices to help you learn while you design.


Perfect for designers who want to create more inclusive products and ensure compliance with accessibility standards (WCAG 2.1). This plugin makes accessibility checking a seamless part of your design workflow rather than an afterthought.


Whether you're new to accessibility or an experienced designer, this tool helps you identify and fix issues early in the design process, saving development time and creating better experiences for all users.

plugins.name: Token Swapper
plugins.description:
To use it, simply activate the plugin, import any component from any library, and it does the rest! 🚀


https://www.loom.com/share/6d526c11f63644318e9c604193e11e3d


Effortless Token Swapping Across Files

Swap Design Tokens between your design system and working files in seconds. Maintain consistency without duplicating libraries or styles.


Full-page Token Replacement

Need to update a full design with new tokens? One click with "Swap All" updates every node, text style, and color variable instantly — no manual work required.


Intelligent Scan & Replace

Automatically scan files for elements not linked to tokens — including colors and fonts — and batch replace them with variables from your design system. Eliminate inconsistencies with a few clicks.


Cross-theme & Project Flexibility

Manage multiple projects with a single design system source. Token Swapper ensures all visual assets remain connected to their proper tokens, even across brands or themes.


Non-destructive Workflow

Token Swapper doesn’t overwrite or break your original styles. Switch between token sets and preview changes without permanent commitment — perfect for testing themes or migrating designs.


Smart Query Processing

Let the plugin process bulk token changes in the background. Your edits persist even when closing the plugin, making large updates smoother and safer.


Beta Features: More Power, More Control

Our beta tools let you go even deeper — manage font tokens, swap icons, and process entire pages. Just stay in the same token session for best results while we keep improving.


FAQs

Does this work with free Figma plans?

Yes! Token Swapper is fully compatible with all Figma plans — free included. No need for professional tiers to keep your tokens in sync.


What if I use my own token naming system?

That’s okay! As long as your token names and structure match across files, Token Swapper will recognize and replace them intelligently.


Why use Token Swapper instead of doing it manually?

Manual token swaps are time-consuming, error-prone, and hard to scale. Token Swapper automates the entire process, saving you hours of work and ensuring consistency.


Tutorials

https://www.loom.com/share/3d743648bd3643e5a50b7dff7d54bbf2

https://www.loom.com/share/b3a6f11e12734fe18da5d30106fe4c54

https://www.loom.com/share/0ec7731eb20f404d9259222377f40cef
plugins.tagline: Swaps font, color and space tokens of components imported from other libraries.

plugins.description:

💡 كيف يعمل البلغين؟

📌 حدد النص والخلفية داخل Figma، ثم اضغط على “تحليل التباين”. سيقوم البلغين بحساب نسبة التباين وإظهار تنبيه فوري يخبرك إن كان التباين متوافقًا أو غير متوافق وفقًا لمعايير WCAG.

plugins.name: Variable JSON
plugins.description:
"Variable JSON – Seamlessly Export Figma Variables to JSON"


Quickly convert your Figma variables into clean JSON with Variable JSON. Select your Collection, Group, and Mode, generate the JSON, and copy it instantly—perfect for streamlining design-to-development workflows.


How to Use:

  1. Open Variable JSON: In Figma, go to Plugins > Variable JSON.
  2. Select Variables: Choose the Collection, Group, and Mode (e.g., Light, Dark, or Custom).
  3. Generate JSON: Click "GEN JSON" to create the JSON output based on your selection.
  4. Copy JSON: Click copy button and use it in your projects.


Effortless variable exporting starts here! 🚀

plugins.name: Banner Framer
plugins.description:
EN description below


バナーサイズの整理をもっと簡単に!!


バナー作成する際、Figmaでのフレームサイズを管理する面倒なストレスを解消します！！Banner Framerを使えば、サイズを忘れたり、フレームの名前を何度も変更する必要がなくなります〜！


Banner Framerの特徴：

•幅と高さを入力するだけでフレームを簡単に生成。

•サイズ情報が含まれた名前を自動で付けて整理をサポート。

•作業効率を上げ、手作業によるミスを軽減。


近日公開：

•サイズプリセットの保存: チームでよく使うバナーサイズを保存して簡単に再利用。

•ワンクリック生成: 保存したサイズをチェックボックスで選択し、瞬時にフレームを生成！

---------------------

Making banner size organization much easier.


Designing banners often requires juggling multiple frame sizes—a task that’s not only repetitive but prone to errors. With Banner Framer, you’ll never forget a size or have to rename frames over and over again.


What Banner Framer does:

•Generate frames effortlessly by entering width and height.

•Automatically name frames with their dimensions for better organization.

•Streamline your workflow and reduce manual errors.


Coming soon:

•Reusable size presets: Save your team’s go-to banner sizes for easy access.

•One-click creation: Select saved sizes with a checkbox and generate frames instantly!
plugins.tagline: Batch-create and customize frames with ease!

Automatic Highlighting:

Customizable Settings:

Adjust minimum word length to match your specific project needs.


Seamless Navigation:

Click a duplicate word tag to navigate directly to all its occurrences within your design.


Intuitive User Interface:

Stylish, user-friendly interface with well-designed tags for optimal usability.


Performance Optimized:

Efficiently handles large files without slowing down Figma's performance.


Why Choose Find Word Duplicate Ninja?


Boost Productivity:

Quickly catch duplicate words, save time, and streamline your workflow.


Improve Consistency:

Ensure consistent text throughout your project without any overlooked duplications.

plugins.name: CSS Variables to Figma
plugins.description:
Import css variables into Figma variables

This plugin enables you import color variables from CSS into Figma, supporting both single-mode and dual Light/Dark mode setups. It maps your CSS variables to Figma's variable modes, converting formats like OKLCH (Tailwind), HEX, RGBA, and RGB into Figma-compatible HEX values. OKLCH, P3, and HCT color values are also preserved and attached to each variable for reference.


Example:


.light {
--color-primary: #000;
}
.dark {
--color-primary: #fff;
}


How it works:

  1. Paste your CSS variables in the text area below.
  2. Click "Export to JSON" to generate a Figma-compatible variables file.
  3. Import the JSON file into Figma using the Figma Variables by Honza Toman


Watch video→ how it works.


Currently supported:

  1. Color variables
  2. Attach oklch, p3 colors and HCT values to variable syntax


Next updates:

  1. Border radius variables
  2. Spacing variables
  3. Shadows
  4. ...


Feedback and support

  1. Let us know your feedback and suggestions! @sans_sherif
  2. Support the development of this plugin buy us a coffee ☕
plugins.tagline: Import existing css variables to figma variables

plugins.name: Figma to Cape Template Designer
plugins.description:
Seamlessly Copy Figma Designs to Template Designer


🚀 Copy layers and frames from Figma directly into Template Designer.

🎨 Save time by avoiding manual recreation—copy, paste, and edit instantly.

⚡ Keep your workflow fast and efficient, focusing on design instead of tedious adjustments.

🔄 Easily update and edit imported layers, plus create unlimited formats.


Perfect for designers who want to work smarter. ✨


How to Use the Plugin

1 Select a frame or layer in Figma and click “Copy” in the plugin.

2 Open Template Designer and paste with ⌘V (or Ctrl + V on Windows).

3 Edit, update, and create multiple formats effortlessly!


Features

✅ Save Time & Work Efficiently

Skip the hassle of recreating designs—copy from Figma and start building immediately.

✅ Editable Layers

Make changes to text, images, and more within Template Designer.

✅ Unlimited Formats

Create multiple formats from a single design.

⚠️ Keep in Mind

Some advanced Figma styling elements may not be fully supported.


What is Template Designer?

Template Designer is part of Campaign Designer from Cape, a powerful tool for creating templates that generate multiple creatives. Designers can set up dynamic layers, allowing campaign managers to edit text, images and many more elements easily—making creative production faster and more scalable.


FAQ

What can I do with the plugin?

Quickly transfer your Figma designs into Template Designer without losing time on manual recreation.


Can I edit designs after pasting them?

Yes! You can edit imported layers, adjust elements, and create different formats.


Which elements are supported?

Most Figma layers, including text, shapes, and images. Some advanced styling may not be fully compatible.


What if I encounter an issue?

Let us know at Cape Support—we’re happy to help! ⚡️


This plugin helps designers work faster, update designs easily, and create scalable templates. Try it now and boost your workflow! 🚀
plugins.tagline: Transform Figma Designs into Template Designer templates

plugins.name: Copy Paste Overrides
plugins.description: A tiny tool that does exactly as described. Useful when working with nested instances. Let's say you have a component that contains a list of items. You are working in an instance of that component and want to switch item 1 with item 2 on the list. You cannot do that because reordering of items is not supported within an instance. But what you can do is just copy and paste the overrides from item 1 to item 2 and vice versa. You're welcome!

plugins.tagline: Copy the overrides of an instance and paste them onto another instance to replicate it

119945.name: Copy Paste Overrides
119945.description: A tiny tool that does exactly as described. Useful when working with nested instances. Let's say you have a component that contains a list of items. You are working in an instance of that component and want to switch item 1 with item 2 on the list. You cannot do that because reordering of items is not supported within an instance. But what you can do is just copy and paste the overrides from item 1 to item 2 and vice versa. You're welcome!
119945.release_notes:
You can copy and paste overrides for component properties from one instance onto another.

Known limitations:
- nested instances don't fully work
- only overrides for specified properties are copied (for example a text that is changed without it being a property won't be copied)
119945.tagline: Copy the overrides of an instance and paste them onto another instance to replicate it

plugins.name: Conjure - AI based text generator
plugins.description:
Introduction


Use your OpenAI API key with this plugin to quickly generate text for your designs. The plugin can allows to generate multiple text layers based on the content. Furthermore, it can also group the layers by their names, allowing you to use the layer names in the prompt to further elaborate how you want the data to be filled in.


How to use


The plugin was primarily created for 2 use cases:


1. Generate variations of a single type of data:

  1. Select all the text layers that show the same type of data and you want to generate variations of it. Imagine Name, City, Stock price, etc.
  2. Make sure 'Group by layer name' is OFF.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!



2. Generate variations of multiple types of data:

  1. Select all the frames or components that you want to fill using this plugin.
  2. Turn ON 'Group by layer name'. The plugin will show you the layer names found.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. You can use the layer names to add specific context. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!


3. Generated related data

You can use the group by layer name to select singular text layers which are related. An example is when you need text for First name, Last name, DoB, role, location and relatives. The plugin will try to generate related content for these layers.


Note


1. This plugin needs an OpenAI API Key to work.

2. I will recommend naming your text layers appropriately if you plan to use the Group by layer name feature. You can use it without naming the layers, but sometimes this might result in unexpected results.
plugins.tagline: OpenAI powered text generator with batch text generation feature
